detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
an act of becoming unconscious

name: compress
trans:
vt. 压紧, 压缩

时 态:  
compressed, compressing, compresses

sentences.english: Light silk is best for parachutes, as it compresses well and then expands rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 轻质丝绸最适合制作降落伞，因为这种面料便于压缩，而且展开迅速。

sentences.english: Isobel nodded, her lips compressed.
sentences.chinese: 伊索贝尔紧闭着双唇点了点头。

sentences.english: The miners used rock drills and compressed air to drive through hard rock.
sentences.chinese: 矿工使用钻岩机和压缩空气来凿穿坚硬的岩石。

detailed_translations.english: to press something or make it smaller so that it takes up less space, or to become smaller
a small thick piece of material that you put on part of someone’s body to stop blood flowing out or to make it less painful

name: resist
trans:
- vt. & vi. 使用武力阻止(某事)发生[取得成功]；抵抗；对抗
- vt. 不受(某事物的)损害[影响]；抗；耐
- 不屈从(某事物或某人)；经得住

时 态:  
resisted，resisting，resists 

名 词:  
resister

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: prosperity
trans:
- n. 幸运；顺利
- 兴旺，繁荣

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: waggon
trans: n. 四轮运货马车；运货车

sentences.english: The ragged man drags a waggon of rag fragments.
sentences.chinese: 那个衣衫褴褛的人拉著一货车破布碎片.

sentences.english: They mounted in front of the waggon, and Abraham grew reflective.
sentences.chinese: 他们上了车，坐在马车的前面，亚伯拉罕开始沉思起来。

sentences.english: He was harnessed to the waggon of beehives in the place of Prince, and the load taken on towards Casterbridge.
sentences.chinese: 他把那匹小马套上拉蜂箱的马车，代替了王子的位置，往卡斯特桥方向驶去了。

name: outlet
trans:
- n. 出口, 出路
- 发泄的途径
- 经销店

sentences.english: a waste water outlet
sentences.chinese: 污水排放口

sentences.english: Is football a good outlet for men’s aggression?
sentences.chinese: 足球是男人宣泄好斗情绪的有效途径吗？

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or hole through which something such as a liquid or gas can flow out

name: voluntary
trans:
- adj. 自愿的, 志愿的
- 义务的, 无偿的

副 词:  
voluntarily

名 词:  
voluntariness

sentences.english: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

detailed_translations.english: done willingly and without being forced

name: rib
trans:
- n. 肋骨，排骨
- 肋骨状的东西；骨架

时 态:  
ribbed，ribbing，ribs

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital with a broken arm and ribs.
sentences.chinese: 她胳膊和肋骨断了，被送进医院。

sentences.english: He was punched and kicked in the ribs.
sentences.chinese: 他的肋部遭到拳打脚踢。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest
to furnish or support with a rib or ribs

name: undo
trans:
- vt. 解开；取消；破坏；扰乱
- vi. 撤消


时 态:  
undid 
undone 
undoing 
undoes  

名 词:  
undoer

sentences.english: The screws can be undone by hand.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺丝可以用手拧开。

sentences.english: I undid the package carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我小心地打开包裹。

sentences.english: He undid most of the good work of the previous manager.
sentences.chinese: 他把前任经理的大部分功绩都毁掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped

name: condense
trans:
- vi. 浓缩；凝结
- vt. 使浓缩；使压缩


时 态:  
condensed, condensing, condenses 

名 词:  
condensability

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

name: damp
trans:
- vt. 使潮湿；使沮丧，抑制；使阻尼
- vi. 减幅，阻尼；变潮湿
- n. 潮湿，湿气
- adj. 潮湿的

dAMP脱氧腺苷酸

比较级:  
damper, dampest 

形容词:  
dampish

副 词:  
damply

名 词:  
dampness

sentences.english: Damp had stained the walls.
sentences.chinese: 墙上留下了潮湿的痕迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使潮湿；使阻尼；使沮丧，抑制
detailed_translations.english: to dampen something
water in walls or in the air that causes things to be slightly wet
slightly wet, often in an unpleasant way

name: pleasant
trans:
- adj. 令人愉快的，舒适的
- 可爱的；友善的
- 晴朗的

比较级:  
pleasanter，pleasantest 

副 词:  
pleasantly

sentences.english: It had been a pleasant evening.
sentences.chinese: 那是个愉快的夜晚。

sentences.english: the pleasant climate of Southern California
sentences.chinese: 南加利福尼亚的宜人气候

sentences.english: The restaurant was large and pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅宽敞舒适。

sentences.english: Kate! What a pleasant surprise !
sentences.chinese: 凯特！真是让人惊喜！

detailed_translations.english: enjoyable or attractive and making you feel happy

name: compute
trans:
- vt. 计算；估算；用计算机计算
- vi. 计算；估算；推断
- n. 计算；推断；估计


时 态:  
computed, computing, computes 

名 词:  
computability

形容词:  
computable

sentences.english: Final results had not yet been computed.
sentences.chinese: 最终的结果还未计算出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算；估算；用计算机计算
detailed_translations.english: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

name: zone
trans:
- n. 地带；地区；[体]联防
- vi. 分成区
- vt. 使分成地带；环绕


时 态:  
zoned, zoning, zones

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

name: corporation
trans: n. 公司

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

name: stitch
trans:
- n. 针脚，线迹；一针
- vt. 缝，缝合
- vi. 缝，缝合


时 态:  
stitched, stitching, stitches 

名 词:  
stitcher

sentences.english: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

name: navigation
trans:
- n. 航行(学)；航海(术)，航空(术)
- 导航，领航

形容词:  
navigational

sentences.english: compasses and other instruments of navigation
sentences.chinese: 罗盘及其他导航仪器

detailed_translations.chinese: 航行， 航海， 航空； 导航， 领航
detailed_translations.english: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another

name: dawn
trans:
- n. 拂晓，破晓，黎明
- 开端；曙光；萌芽
- vi. 破晓；开始
- 见分晓，水落石出；变得明朗
Dawnn. 道恩（女子名）

时 态:  
dawned，dawning，dawns

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

name: glance
trans:
- n. 一瞥；一滑；闪光
- vi. 扫视，匆匆一看；瞥闪，瞥见；反光
- vt. 扫视；瞥见；擦过


时 态:  
glanced, glancing, glances

sentences.english: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。

sentences.english: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

sentences.english: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼，笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to quickly look at someone or something
a quick look
